name: volume-find-clusters
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Filter clusters by volume.

Outputs a volume with nonzero integers for all voxels within a large enough cluster, and zeros elsewhere.  The integers denote cluster membership (by default, first cluster found will use value 1, second cluster 2, etc).  Cluster values are not reused across frames of the output, but instead keep counting up.  By default, values greater than <value-threshold> are considered to be in a cluster, use -less-than to test for values less than the threshold.  To apply this as a mask to the data, or to do more complicated thresholding, see -volume-math.

inputs.name: minimum_volume
inputs.description: threshold for cluster volume, in mm^3

inputs.name: opt_less_than
inputs.description: find values less than <value-threshold>, rather than greater

inputs.name: opt_roi_roi_volume
inputs.description: select a region of interest: the roi, as a volume file

inputs.name: opt_subvolume_subvol
inputs.description: select a single subvolume: the subvolume number or name

inputs.name: opt_size_ratio_ratio
inputs.description: ignore clusters smaller than a given fraction of the largest cluster in map: fraction of the largest cluster's volume

inputs.name: opt_distance_distance
inputs.description: ignore clusters further than a given distance from the largest cluster: how far from the largest cluster a cluster can be, edge to edge, in mm

inputs.name: opt_start_startval
inputs.description: start labeling clusters from a value other than 1: the value to give the first cluster found
